summary: Email correspondence between an FBI Forensic Accountant and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding the preparation and service of a subpoena to Bank of America for records in the Epstein investigation. The email includes instructions for the subpoena's content and where to send the results.

persons.name: Mmlubin
persons.context: FBI Forensic Accountant (email: mmlubin@fbi.gov) listed as a contact for questions regarding the Bank of America subpoena.

connections.description: Both are FBI Forensic Accountants working on the Epstein investigation, with N. coordinating the subpoena and Mmlubin listed as a contact.

events.title: Subpoena Preparation Request
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney requests preparation of a subpoena for Bank of America records, attaching a rider and providing instructions.

events.title: Subpoena Confirmation
events.description: N. confirms receipt of the subpoena request and thanks the Assistant United States Attorney.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Federal Bureau of Investigation, 26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY 10278
FBI New York Field Office, 26 Federal Plaza, NYC, NY 10278
keyFacts: A subpoena was being prepared for Bank of America records as part of the Epstein investigation in October 2019.
The subpoena was coordinated by FBI Forensic Accountants in the New York Field Office.
Results from the subpoena were to be sent electronically to a Special Agent at the FBI's New York office.
The document shows ongoing financial investigation into Epstein's affairs by the Southern District of New York.
The email chain involves coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI on evidence gathering.
